Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly black-figured Komast or Animal, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: at rim, billets beween lines; graffito inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The clumsily executed rim pattern is a common feature on Black Figure Komast and Animal Chalices. See Heidelberg I48 and Lemos no. 1574 from Rhegium.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1255) (phase 2)
